conclusion: Trace the path of the liquid from outlets A, B, C, and D to containers E, F, or G.
Liquid starts from A and moves downward.
Liquid from A encounters a blue baffle that diverts it horizontally to the left.
Liquid continues moving left until it hits another baffle, which redirects it downward.
Liquid from A flows into Container E.
Liquid starts from B and moves downward.
Liquid from B encounters a green baffle that diverts it horizontally to the right.
Liquid continues moving right until it hits another baffle, which redirects it downward.
Liquid from B flows into Container G.
Liquid starts from C and moves downward.
Liquid from C encounters a blue baffle that diverts it horizontally to the right.
Liquid continues moving right until it hits another baffle, which redirects it downward.
Liquid from C flows into Container G.
Liquid starts from D and moves downward.
Liquid from D encounters a yellow baffle that diverts it horizontally to the right.
Liquid continues moving right until it hits another baffle, which redirects it downward.
Liquid from D flows into Container G.
Final Answer: Outlet A flows into Container E, Outlet B flows into Container G, Outlet C flows into Container G, Outlet D flows into Container G.
